intro: Androsace zayulensis, commonly known as the Zayul sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in high-altitude, rocky environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
